title: She Jumped a Turnstile. The Fine Pushed Her to the Breaking Point.
text:
Jasmín Perez was on her way home to the Bronx from a job training program in Queens when, having exhausted her biweekly stipend for subway fare, she jumped a turnstile.

The split-second decision came with a hefty price.

The $100 fine pushed Ms. Perez, 24 , to a financial and emotional breaking point in April, months after her father’s sudden death. That week , she said, she “barely had any money to put food on the table,” to feed her daughter, her mother and herself.

“I thought I was going to die,” she said. “I felt like I was going to get chopped into pieces.”

Ms. Perez grew up the youngest of four siblings in a one-bedroom apartment in the Soundview section of the Bronx that she now shares with her mother and her daughter, Hailey .
description: Reeling from her father’s death, a single mother finds a pathway to stability through a job training program.
